targets.query: SELECT count("gauge") FROM "erlang_vm_dist_node_state" WHERE ("host" =~ /^$hosts$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval)

panels.description: When a connection between a node and peer is established, the distribution link is considered to be `up`

targets.query: SELECT count("gauge") FROM "erlang_vm_dist_node_state" WHERE ("host" =~ /^$hosts$/ AND "gauge" = 3) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(0)

panels.title: Established distribution links

panels.description: When a new connection is exchanging information between the node and the peer the distribution link is considered to be `pending`

targets.query: SELECT count("gauge") FROM "erlang_vm_dist_node_state" WHERE ("host" =~ /^$hosts$/ AND "gauge" = 1) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(0)

panels.title: Connecting distribution links

panels.description: When a new connection is established and there is an existing connection between the node and the peer, this connection needs to wait for the initial connection to go down before it can become active. The distribution link is considered `up_pending`

targets.query: SELECT count("gauge") FROM "erlang_vm_dist_node_state" WHERE ("host" =~ /^$hosts$/ AND "gauge" = 2) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(0)

panels.title: Waiting distribution links

targets.query: SELECT non_negative_derivative(max("gauge"), 1s) FROM "erlang_vm_dist_send_bytes" WHERE ("host" =~ /^$hosts$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "host", "peer"

panels.title: Data sent to peer node / s

panels.description:
Data currently buffered in the output queue of the distribution link

Any values above the 64MB threshold hint to an overloaded distribution

By default, RabbitMQ sets an upper limit of 128MB for the distribution buffer

* [erlang/otp#2270](https://github.com/erlang/otp/pull/2270)
* [erl +zdbbl](http://erlang.org/doc/man/erl.html#+zdbbl)
panels.title: Erlang Run Queues Length

panels.description:
Data currently buffered in the output queue of the distribution link

Any values above the 64MB threshold hint to an overloaded distribution

By default, RabbitMQ sets an upper limit of 128MB for the distribution buffer

* [erlang/otp#2270](https://github.com/erlang/otp/pull/2270)
* [erl +zdbbl](http://erlang.org/doc/man/erl.html#+zdbbl)
panels.title: Data buffered in the distribution links queue

panels.description:
Number of inet packets sent to the distribution link port.

If too few messages are sent and data sits in the port driver buffer, increasing the `inet_dist_connect_options` as well as `inet_dist_listen_options` buffer values will result in more stable throughput.

targets.query: SELECT non_negative_derivative(max("gauge"), 1s) FROM "erlang_vm_dist_send_cnt" WHERE ("host" =~ /^$hosts$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "host", "peer" fill(null)

panels.title: Distribution messages sent to peer node / s
Data received from peer node / s

panels.description:
Number of inet packets sent to the distribution link port.

If too few messages are sent and data sits in the port driver buffer, increasing the `inet_dist_connect_options` as well as `inet_dist_listen_options` buffer values will result in more stable throughput.
panels.title: Distribution messages received from peer node / s

panels.description: The total number of bytes allocated for this port by the runtime system. The port itself can have allocated memory that is not included.

targets.query: SELECT max("gauge") FROM "erlang_vm_dist_port_memory_bytes" WHERE ("host" =~ /^$hosts$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "host", "peer" fill(null)

panels.title: Memory used by the port driver

panels.description:
The total number of bytes queued by the port using the ERTS driver queue implementation

Any values above a few KBs hint to an overloaded distribution

targets.query: SELECT max("gauge") FROM "erlang_vm_dist_port_queue_size_bytes" WHERE ("host" =~ /^$hosts$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "host", "peer" fill(null)

panels.title: Data in the port driver buffer

panels.description: The size in bytes of process memory. This includes call stack, heap, and internal structures.

targets.query: SELECT max("gauge") FROM "erlang_vm_dist_proc_memory_bytes" WHERE ("host" =~ /^$hosts$/ AND "type" =~ /^$erlang_vm_dist_proc_type$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "host", "peer" fill(null)

panels.title: Memory used by the process

panels.description:
The number of messages currently in the message queue of the process

Any values above 0 hint to an overloaded distribution

targets.query: SELECT max("gauge") FROM "erlang_vm_dist_proc_message_queue_len" WHERE ("host" =~ /^$hosts$/ AND "type" =~ /^$erlang_vm_dist_proc_type$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "host", "peer" fill(null)

panels.title: Messages in the process queue

panels.description: The length of the dirty IO scheduler run queues
panels.title: Dirty IO Schedulers Run Queue Length

panels.description: The size in bytes of process memory. This includes call stack, heap, and internal structures.

targets.query: SELECT max("gauge") FROM "erlang_vm_dist_proc_memory_bytes" WHERE ("host" =~ /^$hosts$/ AND "type" =~ /^$erlang_vm_dist_proc_type$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "host", "peer" fill(null)

panels.title: Memory used by the process
